page.title: 05WELSH CHAPEL IN NANTGLYN 1
page.content: The activities of the Welsh Methodist Capel Waen show the Welsh lifestyle of the area. The membership is 90 and half will attend either one of the Welsh services or the Sunday School. The Sunday School has classes for all ages up to adults, with separate groups for men and women. An encouraging sign is the group of 14 teenagers and young people. The minister stresses the value of the family service which has sections on one theme to suit all ages in the congregation. Good support comes for the midweek religious meeting.The young group, called{trwro}was originally a mission group concerned with work in India, its emblem is a dove. Older groups have Bible classes or discussions on video programmes.
